## Import

Let set up a project which generate mapper from struct in imported package.

First define it in `go.mod`:

```go.mod
module github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen/example

go 1.25

require github.com/toniphan21/gmg-lib v0.2.0
```

the `go.sum` file is:

```go.sum
github.com/toniphan21/gmg-lib v0.2.0 h1:MaJMPtFRPVv8DTHhRdr756xaTgsp7sf1TwIYCztFD6w=
github.com/toniphan21/gmg-lib v0.2.0/go.mod h1:BZFmDSo4YijtddTGNCaGQmUFuT6QHn+MnQ0pdYKditE=
```

We have a simple struct in our source code

```go
// file: code.go

package example

import "time"

type User struct {
	Name      string
	ID        string
	Age       int
	Email     string
	UpdatedAt time.Time
	CreatedAt time.Time
}
```

The configuration is:

```pkl
packages {
  ["github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen/example"] {
    source_pkg = "github.com/toniphan21/gmg-lib"

    structs {
      ["User"] { source_struct_name = "User" }
    }
  }
}
```

With the configuration it generates a mapper from `github.com/toniphan21/gmg-lib.User` to `User` struct in source code:

```go
// golden-file: gen_mapper.go
// Code generated by github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen - test, DO NOT EDIT.

package example

import gmglib "github.com/toniphan21/gmg-lib"

type iMapper interface {
	// ToUser converts a gmg.User value into a User value.
	ToUser(in gmglib.User) User

	// FromUser converts a User value into a gmg.User value.
	FromUser(in User) gmglib.User
}

func new_iMapper() iMapper {
	return &iMapperImpl{}
}

type iMapperImpl struct{}

func (m *iMapperImpl) ToUser(in gmglib.User) User {
	var out User

	out.Name = in.Name
	out.ID = in.ID
	out.Age = in.Age
	out.Email = in.Email
	out.UpdatedAt = in.UpdatedAt
	out.CreatedAt = in.CreatedAt

	return out
}

func (m *iMapperImpl) FromUser(in User) gmglib.User {
	var out gmglib.User

	out.ID = in.ID
	out.Name = in.Name
	out.Email = in.Email
	out.Age = in.Age
	out.CreatedAt = in.CreatedAt
	out.UpdatedAt = in.UpdatedAt

	return out
}

var _ iMapper = (*iMapperImpl)(nil)
```
